name: will_paginate 3.1.6
body: Reference Integer instead of Fixnum to avoid Ruby 2.4 deprecation warning.

name: will_paginate 3.0.12
body: - No longer generates `<a rel="start">` for first page link since "start" is an invalid rel value

name: will_paginate 3.1.5
body:
- Avoid Rails 5 deprecation warning about `original_exception`
- No longer generates `<a rel="start">` for first page link since "start" is an invalid rel value

name: will_paginate 2.3.17
body: - Avoid unintentional SQL queries being triggered by defining `respond_to_missing?` alongside `method_missing?`

name: will_paginate 3.0.10
body: - Fix locale load path so that application can override will_paginate's built-in translations.

name: will_paginate 3.1.3
body:
- Rails 5 compatibility for inheriting query params in pagination links
- Fix locale load path so that application can override will_paginate's built-in translations.

name: will_paginate 3.0.9
body: Further fix security vulnerability when generating pagination URLs in Rails.

name: will_paginate 3.1.2
body: Further fix security vulnerability when generating pagination URLs in Rails.

name: will_paginate 3.1.1
body: Fixed security vulnerability when generating pagination URLs in Rails.

name: will_paginate 3.0.8
body: Fixed security vulnerability when generating pagination URLs in Rails.

name: will_paginate 3.1.0
body:
- Rails 5.0 support
- Drop support for old Active Record finder params to `paginate()`:
  
  ``` rb
  # now unsupported:
  User.paginate(:page => 1, :order => 'created_at DESC', :conditions => ...)
  
  # convert to Arel syntax instead:
  User.order('created_at DESC').where(...).paginate(:page => 1)
  # or, even better:
  User.order('created_at DESC').where(...).page(1)
  ```
- Add support for pagination with Mongoid

---

will_paginate is compatible with:
- Ruby 1.8.7, 1.9.3, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3
- Rails 3.0, 3.1, 3.2, 4.0, 4.1, 4.2, 5.0
- Active Record, DataMapper, Sequel, Mongoid
- Database adapters: mysql, mysql2, postgres, sqlite3

name: will_paginate 3.0.7
body: - Fix `count` method to work with `select` statement.

name: will_paginate 3.0.6
body:
- Rails 4.1 compatibility
- Accept arguments for Relation#count

name: will_paginate 3.0.5: bugfix & security release
body:
- fix [CVE-2013-6459](http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2013-6459&cid=1): XSS in generated pagination links
- always call `html_safe` if available on will_paginate result
- exclude `reorder` for count queries
